snippet: The first commercial mission to ferry supplies to the International Space Station ended successfully Thursday when the Dragon capsule fell to earth on target in the Pacific Ocean off Mexico.
abstract: Dragon, the first commercial spacecraft to ferry supplies into space, touches down in the Pacific Ocean following a successful mission; unmanned capsule carried about 1,100 pounds of food, water, clothing and equipment to the International Space Station.
lead_paragraph: The first commercial mission to ferry supplies to the International Space Station ended successfully Thursday when the Dragon capsule fell to earth on target in the Pacific Ocean off Mexico.

headline.seo: First SpaceX Dragon Cargo Flight Ends With a Splash
headline.main: Its First Mission Done, SpaceX Looks to More Private Flights
headline.print_headline: Home With the Trash, SpaceX Looks to More Private Flights
